snippet.title: The impeccably timed Knicks fan protest
snippet.description:
The impeccably timed Knicks fan protest by Seth Rosenthal on Mar 20 2014, 10:41a
Forty-odd Knicks fans showed up to protest outside Madison Square Garden ... days after their demands had already been met.

snippet.title: We *just* missed the dream of a snowy Super Bowl
snippet.description:
We *just* missed the dream of a snowy Super Bowl by Michael Katz on Feb 3 2014, 11:03a
What a difference 12 hours makes.

snippet.title: This is what it's like to get free ice cream from Rex Ryan

snippet.title: Your Super Bowl XLVIII guide to hot takes
snippet.description:
Your Super Bowl XLVIII guide to hot takes by Eric Sollenberger on Jan 27 2014, 12:01p
One week to get ready for one game also means plenty of new angles on the same old stories. Eric Sollenberger has a handy guide to the week in narratives.

snippet.title: Open city: The U.S. Open is an expensive ticket and awash in brand synergy and in-your-face sponsorship, because it's a contemporary sporting event. It's also weird, diverse, positive and, yes, open -- because it's in New York.
snippet.description:
Open city: The U.S. Open is an expensive ticket and awash in brand synergy and in-your-face sponsorship, because it's a contemporary sporting event. It's also weird, diverse, positive and, yes, open -- because it's in New York. by David Roth on Sep 5 2013, 12:32p
When John Rocker began the still-ongoing process of blowing up his life, it was in part because of a long, bigoted bitch about the things a person will see on the 7 train. "Imagine having to take...

snippet.title: David Stern will retire: Answering some questions about the future and the past
snippet.description:
David Stern will retire: Answering some questions about the future and the past by Andrew Sharp on Oct 25 2012, 3:22p
David Stern announced Thursday that he will step down as NBA Commissioner in February of 2014. Now, let's answer some questions about where we go from here -- and where we've been.
